name: Field Commander
specialRules: Field Commander has Commanding Presence(1), Scoring
description: The Imperial Officer Corps is one of the Empires most esteemed institutions and competition for admission is fierce and foul play common. Detractors often deride the Corps for being bloated and corrupt but, while some of the criticism is warranted, in times of strife the Corps time and again produces great personalities that lead the Empire to victory.
startingCost: Field Commander Squad Leader and 4 Aides for 50pts
availability: Must include one and one only Field Commander unit

options.choice: Field Commander may replace Rifle with
alternatives: Pistol and Melee Specialist for free

options.choice: One Aide may replace Rifle with
Field Commander may take one Call-in

name: Guards Infantry
description: The Guards Regiments make up the bulk of the Imperial Army and it is they who do most of the fighting, and dying, when the Empire wages war. The life of a Guardsman is tough but 'hardship breeds strength', or so the recruiting slogans go.

options.choice: May add up to 5
Squad Leader may replace Rifle with
alternatives: Pistol and Melee Specialist for free

options.choice: May replace 2 Guardsmen for a weapon team with Base Size 40mm, Team(2), Unwieldy and

name: Conscripts Infantry
description: All able men of the Empire preform mandatory military service so that in times of great need they can be called upon to defend their homes. Hastily equipped and thrust into combat these troops help plug holes and hold ground.

options.choice: May add up to 5

name: Jaeger Infantry
description: The Jaegers are the Empires elite special forces capable of operating independently deep in hostile territory. During war they specialize in reconnaissance, sabotage and ambush tactics, during peace they preform anti-insurgency and espionage operations.

options.choice: May add up to 5
Squad Leader may replace Rifle with
alternatives: Pistol and Melee Specialist for free

options.choice: One Jaeger may take
May replace 2 Jaegers for a weapon team with Base Size 40mm, Team(2), Unwieldy and

name: Storm Troopers
description: The Imperial Storm Troopers are the handpicked personal soldiers of the Emperor. They serve as shock troops specialized in close quarters combat and have a reputation for brutality. Feared both by the enemies of the Empire and Imperial politicians, they are personally deployed by the Emperor wherever he sees fit.

options.choice: May add up to 5
Squad Leader may replace SMG with
alternatives: Pistol and Melee Specialist for free

options.choice: One Trooper may replace SMG with

name: Lancer Cavalry
description: Though mostly ceremonial, and the occasional riot suppression, the Lancers themselves certainly wouldn't agree with that characterization and are always keen to prove their usefulness in times of war. They serve as scouts and quick response forces and are known for incessant optimism and glory seeking.

options.choice: May add up to 5
Any Lancer may replace Pistol and Impact(2) with
One Lancer may take
May replace Medium Machine Gun with

name: Support Gun
specialRules: Cumbersome, Fixed, Gun Shield, Move or Fire, Team(4)

options.choice: Must take one
alternatives: Light Howitzer and Spotter for free

name: Heavy Support Gun
specialRules: Cumbersome, Fixed, Gun Shield, Move or Fire, Team(6)

options.choice: Must take one
alternatives: Medium Howitzer and Spotter for free
Heavy Mortar, Spotter and lose Gun Shield for free

name: Grizzly Heavy Tank
equipment: Turret mounted Heavy AT-gun with Coax Medium Machine Gun, Front mounted Medium Machine Gun

name: Antlion Medium Tank
equipment: Turret mounted Medium Autocannon, Forward mounted Medium Machine Gun

name: Bullfrog Light Tank
equipment: Turret mounted Twin-linked(2) Medium Machine Gun

name: Bloodhound Armored Car
equipment: Turret mounted Light Autocannon with Coax Medium Machine Gun

name: Mammoth Mortar Carrier
equipment: Forward mounted Heavy Mortar with Blast(2D3+1) and Move or Fire, Forward mounted Medium Machine Gun

name: Bison APC
availability: Up to 1 Transport per transportable unit
